title: Far North Community Associates: Feast for your Eyes—Conversation with Allison Muscolino
hero_caption: Pieter Claesz. Still Life, about 1625. Simeon B. Williams Fund.
description:
What makes still life painting as appetizing as the delicacies they depict? This talk explores the legacy of still life painting with works from 17th-century Dutch masters and extending through contemporary food photography.

The setting for this talk is The Gallery, an art gallery and culinary studio, which varies its menu based on the art that is on display.

Schedule of the Day:

11:30 Arrive at The Gallery*
12:00 Lunch
1:00 Lecture

*Please note that parking is limited and sharing rides is recommended.

Registration Period: February 14, 2019–February 28, 2019

This Community Associates event is exclusively for current Community Associates members. Membership will be verified at the door, and refunds cannot be issued for those without a valid membership. For Community Associates events that allow guests, nonmember guests must be registered by a Community Associates member.

If you are interested in becoming a member of Community Associates, please visit artic.edu/joinnow to join both the Art Institute of Chicago and the Community Associates group of your choice.
